member.name: T:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Messages.AStarLog
member.summary: Provides strongly-typed logging methods for common HTTP status codes and errors in AStar applications.
Provides strongly-typed logging methods for common HTTP status codes and errors in AStar applications.

member.name: T:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Messages.AStarLog.Application
member.summary: Provides logging methods for application lifecycle events, including startup, shutdown, and error conditions.
member.remarks: This class offers static methods to log key application events using structured logging. All methods require an instance and are intended to be used within application startup and shutdown routines. The logging methods use predefined event IDs and log levels to ensure consistent event tracking across the application. This class is thread-safe and can be used from any context where logging is required.

member.param: The logger instance to use.

The exception message that caused the failure.

member.name: T:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.Serilog
member.summary: The class used to configure Serilog.

member.name: P:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.Serilog.Enrich
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of enrichment operations to apply to the data.
member.remarks: Each entry specifies an enrichment type or transformation that will be performed. The order of operations in the array determines the sequence in which enrichments are applied.

member.name: P:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.Serilog.WriteTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of sinks to which log events are written.
member.remarks: Each element in the array specifies a destination and configuration for log output. Common sinks include file, console, or external log servers. The order of sinks in the array determines the sequence in which log events are dispatched.

member.name: P:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.Serilog.MinimumLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum log level that must be met for log events to be recorded.
member.remarks: Adjust this property to control which log messages are processed based on their severity. Log events below the specified level will be ignored.

member.name: T:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.SerilogConfig
member.summary: The class that contains the Serilog configuration.

member.name: P:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.SerilogConfig.Serilog
member.summary: Gets or sets the Serilog configuration and logger instance used for structured logging within the application.
member.remarks: Configure this property to customize logging behavior, such as output sinks, log levels, and enrichment. Changing the Serilog instance affects how log events are processed and where they are written.

member.name: P:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.SerilogConfig.Logging
member.summary: Gets or sets the logging configuration for the application.
member.remarks: Use this property to customize logging behavior, such as log levels, output destinations, and formatting options. Changes to the logging configuration take effect immediately and may impact how diagnostic information is recorded.

member.name: T:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.WriteTo
member.summary: The class that configures the relevant WriteTo Serilog logger.

member.name: P:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.WriteTo.Name
member.summary: The Name of the WriteTo option.

member.name: P:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Models.WriteTo.Args
member.summary: Gets or sets the command-line arguments for the current operation.

member.name: M:AStar.Dev.Logging.Extensions.Serilog.SerilogExtensions.ConfigureAStarDevelopmentLoggingDefaults(Serilog.LoggerConfiguration,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configures a with the default AStar settings and sinks.
member.param: The logger configuration to update.
Application configuration to read Serilog settings from.
When true, adds a rolling file sink; set to false in unit tests to avoid real IO.
